info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 3:29PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Wasatch...southeastern Salt Lake and north central Utah Counties through 400 PM MDT... At 329 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Alpine, or 12 miles southeast of Sandy, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lehi, Draper, Pleasant Grove, American Fork, Heber, Lindon, Alpine, Daniel, Little Cottonwood Canyon, Wasatch Mountain State Park, Big Cottonwood Canyon, Highland, Cedar Hills, Midway, Charleston, Alta, Deer Creek State Park, Snowbird, Mt Timpanogos and Sundance. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
